column4: hi all :) just wanted to ask how can i make ubuntu open a software automaticly on startup , when i boot my linux?
when it boots or when you log in??
you can make an init script for it based on /etc/init.d/skeleton or just call it from /etc/rc.local
just add it to the end of the doc?
wait... but how can i know where is the executable file of the software?
yakuake is a graphical app (terminal emulatro) that needsa display and a user... you want to launch it when you log in not when the system boots
or the kde equivalent for that
